epipelagic.description: This is the zone in which photosynthesis can occur, because light is available.

mesopelagic.description: This is also known as the twilight zone, because light becomes limited. There is less oxygen available to organisms in this zone.

bathypelagic.description: This is a dark zone where water pressure is high and the water is cold (around 35-39 degrees).

abyssopelagic.description: This is the zone past the continental slope - the deep water just over the ocean bottom. This is also known as the abyssal zone.

hadopelagic.description: In some places, there are trenches that are deeper than the surrounding ocean floor. These areas are the hadopelagic zone. At a depth of over 36,000 feet, the Mariana Trench is the deepest known point in the ocean.
